tit.cmt: 半角スペースにしました。

sen.j: 京都宝塚会館（きょうとたからづかかいかん）は、かつて京都府京都市中京区河原町六角に所在していた東宝系の映画館（京都宝塚劇場、京都スカラ座）の総称である。
sen.e: The Kyoto Takarazuka Hall is a general name for Toho chain theaters (Kyoto Takarazuka Theater, Kyoto Scala-za) formerly located in Rokkaku, Kawaramachi, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
The Kyoto Takarazuka Hall is a general name for Toho chain theaters (Kyoto Takarazuka Theater, Kyoto Scala-za) formerly located in Rokkaku, Kawaramachi, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
The Kyoto Takarazuka Hall is a general name for Toho chain theaters (Kyoto Takarazuka Theater, Kyoto Scala-za) formerly located in Rokkaku, Kawaramachi, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 略称は「京宝会館」（けいほう -）。
sen.e: Its abbreviation is 'Keiho Kaikan'.
Its abbreviation is 'Keiho Kaikan'.
Its abbreviation is 'Keiho Kaikan'.

sen.j: 1935年10月：京都宝塚劇場としてオープン。
sen.e: October 1935: It opened under the name of Kyoto Takarazuka Theater.
October 1935: It opened under the name of the Kyoto Takarazuka Theater.
October 1935: Opened under the name of the Kyoto Takarazuka Theater.

sen.j: 当初は演劇と映画の上映の二本立てであった。
sen.e: At the beginning, the theater offered the double bill consisted of a theatrical performance and a film showing.
At the beginning, the theater offered a double billing consisting of a theatrical performance and a film showing.
At the beginning, the theater offered a double billing consisting of a theatrical performance and a film showing.

sen.j: こけら落しは宝塚歌劇団花組_(宝塚歌劇)『花詩集』。
sen.e: The inaugural performance was Takarazuka Revue titled "Flower Anthology" performed by Takarazuka Revue Flower Troupe.
The inaugural performance was the Takarazuka Revue titled "Flower Anthology" performed by the Takarazuka Revue Flower Troupe.
The inaugural performance was the Takarazuka Revue titled "Flower Anthology" performed by the Takarazuka Revue Flower Troupe.

sen.j: 座席数は1,452。
sen.e: The seating capacity is 1452 seats.
The seating capacity was 1452 seats.
The seating capacity was 1452 seats.

sen.j: 1945年10月：連合国軍最高司令官総司令部により接収となる。
sen.e: October 1945: It was requisitioned by the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: October 1945: It was requisitioned by the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers.
October 1945: Requisitioned by the General Headquarters of the Allied Powers.

sen.j: 館名も「ステイトサイド・シアター」となる。
sen.e: Its name was also changed to 'Stateside Theater'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Its name was also changed to 'Stateside Theater.'
Its name was also changed to 'Stateside Theater.'

sen.j: 日本人は観客としての出入りが禁止された。
sen.e: The Japanese were forbidden to enter the theater as an audience.
The Japanese were forbidden to enter the theater as an audience.
The Japanese were forbidden to enter the theater as an audience.

sen.j: 1952年7月：接収解除。
sen.e: July 1952: It was derequisitioned.
July 1952: It was derequisitioned.
July 1952: Derequisitioned.

sen.j: 洋画ロードショー劇場として再オープン。
sen.e: It reopened as a road show movie theater for foreign films.
It reopened as a road show movie theater for foreign films.
It reopened as a road show movie theater for foreign films.

sen.j: 1956年8月：増築により洋画封切館の京都スカラ座がオープン。
sen.e: August 1956: In a new extension building, Kyoto Scala-za opened as a first-run movie theater for foreign films.
August 1956: In a new extended building, Kyoto Scala-za opened as a first-run movie theater for foreign films.
August 1956: In a new extended building, Kyoto Scala-za opened as a first-run movie theater for foreign films.

sen.j: 座席数は802。
sen.e: The seating capacity is 802 seats.
The seating capacity was 802 seats.
The seating capacity was 802 seats.

sen.j: 同時に「京都宝塚会館」という総称を与えられた。
sen.e: At that time, these theaters came to be collectively called 'the Kyoto Takarazuka Hall'.
At that time, these theaters came to be collectively called 'the Kyoto Takarazuka Hall.'
At that time, these theaters came to be collectively called 'the Kyoto Takarazuka Hall.'

sen.j: 1962年11月：京都宝塚劇場が東宝邦画系封切館となる。
sen.e: November 1962: Kyoto Takarazuka Theater became a Toho chain first-run movie theater for Japanese films
November 1962: The Kyoto Takarazuka Theater became a Toho chain of first-run movie theaters for Japanese films
November 1962: The Kyoto Takarazuka Theater became a Toho chain of first-run movie theaters for Japanese films
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 1971年7月：リニューアルオープン。
sen.e: July 1971: It reopened after remodeling.
July 1971: It reopened after being remodeled.
July 1971: Reopened after being remodeled.

sen.j: 2005年9月：閉館を発表。
sen.e: September 2005: The close down of the theater was announced.
September 2005: The closing down of the theater was announced.
September 2005: The closing down of the theater was announced.

sen.j: 2006年1月28日・1月29日：「街（かわらまち）の灯よ、ありがとう」と題したラストショーを京極東宝とともに開催し、70年間の歴史に幕を下ろした。
sen.e: January 28 and 29, 2006: The last event titled 'Thanks for the lights of Kawaramachi' was held in cooperation with Kyogoku Toho, which event brought the curtain down on its 70 years of history.
January 28 and 29, 2006: The last event titled 'Thanks for the lights of Kawaramachi' was held in cooperation with Kyogoku Toho, an event that brought the curtain down on its 70 years of history.
January 28 and 29, 2006: The last event titled 'Thanks for the lights of Kawaramachi' was held in cooperation with Kyogoku Toho, an event that brought the curtain down on its 70 years of history.

sen.j: 最終上映作品は『七人の侍』『街の灯』であった。
sen.e: The last movies shown in the theater were "Seven Samurai" and "City Lights".
The last movies shown in the theater were "Seven Samurai" and "City Lights."
The last movies shown in the theater were "Seven Samurai" and "City Lights."

sen.j: また、高知市にあった同じ東宝系の映画館「高知東宝1・2・3」も同じ日に閉館している。
sen.e: Kochi Toho1, 2 and 3', which belonged to the same Toho chain cinemas and was located in Kochi City, was also closed down on the same day.
Kochi Toho1, 2 and 3', which belonged to the same Toho chain cinemas and was located in Kochi City, was also closed down on the same day.
Kochi Toho1, 2 and 3', which belonged to the same Toho chain cinemas and was located in Kochi City, was also closed down on the same day.

sen.j: 2008年4月25日：京都宝塚会館跡地に複合商業ビル「ミーナ京都」がオープンした。
sen.e: April 25, 2008: The Complex Commercial Establishments called 'Mina' (including the commercial institution called "Mina Kyoto') opened at the site where the Kyoto Takarazuka Hall had used to be.
April 25, 2008: The Complex Commercial Establishments called 'Mina' (including the commercial institution called "Mina Kyoto') opened at the site where the Kyoto Takarazuka Hall had used to be.
April 25, 2008: The Complex Commercial Establishments called 'Mina' opened at the site where the Kyoto Takarazuka Hall had used to be.
sen.cmt: ウェブのリンク文字列を原文から削除し、訳文を修正しました。

sen.j: ※座席数は閉館時のもの。
sen.e: *The seating capacity is as of the date of closing.
*The seating capacity on the date of closing.
The seating capacity is on the date of closing.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 京都宝塚劇場
sen.e: Kyoto Takarazuka Theater
Kyoto Takarazuka Theater
Kyoto Takarazuka Theater

sen.j: 定員588人。
sen.e: Seating capacity: 588.
Seating capacity: 588.
Seating capacity: 588
sen.cmt: ピリオドをのぞきました。

sen.j: 東宝邦画系作品のみを上映。
sen.e: It specialized in Toho chain Japanese films.
Specialized in Toho chain Japanese films.
Specialized in Toho chain Japanese films.

sen.j: 日比谷映画→TOHOシネマズ日劇系列のチェーン。
sen.e: It firstly belonged to Hibiya Cinema chain and secondly to Toho Cinemas Nichigeki chain.
First belonged to the Hibiya Cinema chain and secondly to Toho Cinemas Nichigeki chain.
First belonged to the Hibiya Cinema chain and secondly to Toho Cinemas Nichigeki chain.

sen.j: 1カ月に1作程度の割合で、新作が公開された。
sen.e: It screened a new movie almost once in a month.
It screened a new movie almost once a month.
It screened a new movie almost once a month.

sen.j: 京都スカラ座
sen.e: Kyoto Scala-za
Kyoto Scala-za
Kyoto Scala-za

sen.j: 定員507人。
sen.e: Seating capacity: 507
Seating capacity: 507
Seating capacity: 507

sen.j: 常に、大作の東宝洋画系作品を上映。
sen.e: It always screened foreign monumental films distributed by Toho chain cinemas.
Always screened foreign monumental films distributed by Toho chain cinemas.
Always screened foreign monumental films distributed by Toho chain cinemas.

sen.j: TOHOシネマズ有楽座→日本劇場→日劇1系列のチェーン。
sen.e: It firstly belonged to Toho Cinemas Yurakuza chain, secondly to Toho Cinemas Yurakuza chain, and thirdly to Nichigeki 1 chain.
First belonged to Toho Cinemas Yurakuza chain, secondly to Toho Cinemas Yurakuza chain, and thirdly to Nichigeki 1 chain.
First belonged to Toho Cinemas Yurakuza chain, secondly to Nihon Gekijo Theater chain, and thirdly to Nichigeki 1 chain.

sen.j: ※両館とも最末期はドルビーデジタルとデジタル・シアター・システムズに対応していた。
sen.e: *In the last state, the both theaters supported Dolby Digital and Digital Theater Systems.
*In the last state, the both theaters supported Dolby Digital and Digital Theater Systems.
In the last state, the both theaters supported Dolby Digital and Digital Theater Systems.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
